intro_only_event_multi_sv_advertise/6901:
It seems that there’s an academy in the Paldea
region where you can learn about things like
Pokémon battling.

I wonder if it’s similar to the Trainers’ School that
we’re familiar with.

As a teacher, I’m interested in what they teach
and what you can learn there as a student.

There are so many things to learn about Pokémon
battles... Even teachers can struggle with it all.

How you think and battle as a Trainer can change
based on what you learn.
I’m curious about what kind of students they have.

The more students there are, the more battles they
can have, which means they’ll be able to learn
many things.

Oh! Also, apparently students at this academy
wear uniforms.

Uniforms? How lovely! I’d love to try one on as a
student, even just once.
intro_only_event_multi_sv_advertise/6902:
Do you know about a Pokémon called
Sprigatito, Erika?
Sprigatito? I wonder what kind of Pokémon that is.

It’s a very cute Grass Cat Pokémon that has a
sweet side to it.

The fur on its body has a similar composition to
plants, so it can photosynthesize.

What a cute and wonderful Pokémon. I’d love to
meet one some day.

When it kneads and rubs with its forepaws,
it releases a sweet aroma that can mesmerize
those around it.

The aroma has therapeutic qualities and makes
opponents lose their will to battle.
Whoa, Erika! Did she just fall asleep?
intro_only_event_multi_sv_advertise/6903: The information we have so far about Fuecoco is...

It absorbs external heat through the square scales
on its stomach and back...
and converts it into fire energy.

I’ve seen many Fire-type Pokémon, but this kind of
mechanic in the body is very intriguing.

Huh... I wonder what will happen when it’s in a
hot place.

The flame on its head is fire energy that’s leaking
out from inside its body.

When Fuecoco gets excited, its head spouts
more flames.

Oh, that’s fire energy? That’s very similar to
Charmander’s tail!
I think it’s cute how the flame sways!

Fuecoco’s carefree and laid back, so it seems fun
to be around! I think it might get along well
with Totodile!

Hmm... You seem to be looking at it from a
different perspective, Kris.
intro_only_event_multi_sv_advertise/6904:
Marlon, have you ever heard of a Pokémon
called Quaxly?

Apparently, its body is always glossy because of
the gel secreted by its feathers.

The coif on its head is slicked back using cream,
and it becomes unkempt when dry.

That hair styled beautifully round...
How wonderful!
Its desire to look well-groomed is very elegant.
All I heard was that it’s good at swimming.

Folks say it has strong legs, so it can swim around
even in spots with strong currents.

I love swimming, too, so I’d like to go swimming
in the ocean with it!
It’ll probably be tough to keep up with you, but...

I’d love to meet the bold and beautiful Quaxly at
least once.
